basics.name: Amrit Baral
basics.label: Epidemiologist & PhD Candidate
basics.summary: Public health researcher with expertise in cannabis and psychedelic epidemiology, cardiovascular and cancer outcomes, and national surveillance datasets. Experienced in data management, statistical analysis, IRB processes, and academic publishing.

work.name: University of Miami, Miller School of Medicine
work.summary: Leads biostatistics and data management for NIH-funded cannabis and cardiovascular health studies. Conducts statistical analyses, co-authors peer-reviewed publications, and mentors students.
highlights: Psychedelic & Cannabis Communication in Cancer Care (NCI-funded)
Evaluation of Chronic Cannabis Use on Brain Imaging (MMJ Outcomes Research)

work.name: Chester County Health Department
work.summary: Conducted outbreak investigations, analyzed surveillance data, and supported public health education related to infectious disease control.

courses: Dissertation: Co-Use of Classic Psychedelics and Cannabis and Cancer
Clinical Internship at Western Regional Hospital, Nepal

projects.name: Herbal Heart Study
projects.summary: NIH-funded study investigating cannabis and cardiovascular health in diverse young adults.

projects.name: COVID-19 Cannabis Health Study
projects.summary: Examined health behaviors, cannabis and psilocybin use trends during the pandemic.

projects.name: Cannabis & Cancer Communication Study
projects.summary: Studied cannabis use discussions between patients and providers at an NCI-designated center.
